title: Bill Belichick's legacy takes a detour at North Carolina
content: A season in, the legendary NFL coach's head-scratching decision to helm a lowly ACC team continues to confound.

title: Jennings hits Moehrig after MNF over 'cheap shot'
content: 49ers wide receiver Jauan Jennings responded to a "cheap shot" from Tre'von Moehrig by throwing an open-handed right cross to the Panthers safety's face mask after the final whistle Monday night.

title: Sources: Bucs get good news on Mayfield's MRI
content: The MRI for Buccaneers quarterback Baker Mayfield revealed a low-grade AC joint sprain in his left shoulder but showed no additional damage, sources told ESPN's Jeremy Fowler on Monday.

title: Pistons tie '90, '04 title teams, win 13th in row
content: Guard Cade Cunningham and the surging Detroit Pistons, who set an NBA record for consecutive losses in a single NBA season with 28 in 2023, tied a franchise record Monday night with their 13th straight victory, defeating the Indiana Pacers 122-117.

title: Brees, Rivers lead list of 2026 HOF semifinalists
content: Five newcomers -- QBs Drew Brees and Philip Rivers, WR Larry Fitzgerald, TE Jason Witten and RB Frank Gore -- are among the 26 modern era candidates to make it to the semifinal stage for the Pro Football Hall of Fame 2026 class.

title: Attorneys: LSU saga hindering Kelly job candidacy
content: Attorneys for Brian Kelly have informed LSU in a letter that the school's claim that it had not "formally terminated" Kelly as its football coach has "made it nearly impossible" for Kelly to get another coaching job.

title: Herro keeps red-hot Heat rolling in season debut
content: Tyler Herro eventually got going in his return from ankle surgery in September and led Miami to a win over Dallas on Monday night.

title: Dodgers star Ohtani to play for Japan in WBC
content: Dodgers superstar Shohei Ohtani will play for Team Japan in the 2026 World Baseball Classic as the country looks to defend their 2023 title.

title: Chase sorry for spitting: 'What I did was wrong'
content: Bengals wide receiver Ja'Marr Chase apologized Monday for spitting on Steelers defensive back Jalen Ramsey.

title: Men's: Duke, the 1-seed no one's really talking about
content: The headlines might not be screaming about them, but we're noticing the Blue Devils' 1-seed-worthy résumé.

title: Women's: Is Duke in danger of falling out of the field?
content: The Blue Devils have fallen short of preseason expectations, while rising Michigan has blown past them.

title: Updated NFL Power Rankings: New 1-32 poll, plus Thanksgiving game memories
content: Let's update our NFL Power Rankings ahead of Week 13. We also picked out Thanksgiving memories for 31 teams that have played on the holiday (sorry, Jaguars).

title: Jokic, SGA, Giannis and Luka are off to historic starts: Why this MVP race could be epic
content: Nikola Jokic, Shai Gilgeous-Alexander, Giannis Antetokounmpo and Luka Doncic are off to scorching starts. What does it mean for the MVP race?

title: Why LeBron James' most remarkable NBA streak is now at risk
content: James' double-digit scoring streak is intact, but his other streak is even more remarkable -- and now in danger.

title: The untold story of John Cena's rap album, 'You Can't See Me'
content: "The Doctor of Thuganomics" wasn't just a gimmick. Andreas Hale spoke to the musicians who worked with Cena on his album from 20 years ago.

title: 30 best pro wrestlers under 30: Did 'Dirty Dom' repeat in 2025?
content: Who are the best young stars across professional wrestling? We rank the top 30 wrestlers under age 30.

title: Why Bayern boss Kompany is well placed to succeed Guardiola at Man City
content: If Bayern's clash with Arsenal is an audition to replace Pep Guardiola, ex-City defender and ESPN FC analyst Nedum Onuoha thinks Kompany fits the bill.

title: Lane Kiffin has a near $100 million decision coming Saturday. He better win Friday
content: As drama at Ole Miss drags on, there's a game to play Friday. The pressure on Kiffin to win will be overwhelming.

title: Inside Lions DE Aidan Hutchinson's contract extension, and Micah Parsons' role
content: The Lions wanted to sign Hutchinson to a long-term contract, but deals for other pass rushers, especially Micah Parsons, kept moving the target.

title: They hired who?! Making sense of MLB's newest class of managers
content: A 33-year-old, a college coach, a recently retired reliever ... it's been quite an offseason for unconventional skippers. What does it mean?

title: How good are this year's top Japanese free agents -- and who could sign them?
content: We break down what to expect from Tatsuya Imai, Munetaka Murakami and Kazuma Okamoto in 2026 and where they might land.

title: Can the Predators turn their season around?
content: Nashville is the NHL's worst team in the standings. Is there any hope of contention -- or is it time to make trades?

title: Man United have improved under Amorim, but closer look at metrics paints harsh picture
content: It has been one year since Ruben Amorim's first game in charge of Man United. There has been some improvement, but the core metrics of Amorim's influence tell a different story.

title: What to know about Damon Jones, the man at the center of two NBA scandals
content: After making more than $21 million across 11 seasons in the NBA, the NBA journeyman fell hard -- and, prosecutors allege, into a life of crime.

title: Haney takes over at welterweight, Mason makes debut at 135
content: Devin Haney and Abdullah Mason shined in decision victories. Here are the latest ESPN rankings in all weight classes.

title: Despite some lackluster offenses on Monday night, some 49ers and Panthers stood out
content: Eric Moody finds some silver linings in the inefficient play of QBs Brock Purdy and Bryce Young on Monday night.

title: Solak spins Week 12 forward: Should Browns stick with Sanders? Could Colts lose AFC South?
content: Ben Solak sizes up Shedeur Sanders' first start, the sudden three-team race in the AFC South, George Pickens' next contract and Week 12 trends to watch.

title: MLS Cup conference semis talking points: All roads lead to Miami, Messi
content: Inter Miami's first MLS Cup is within reach after a convincing win over FC Cincinnati. Here's what else stood out from the conference semis.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Chelsea, Man United eye new Germany star Ouédraogo
content: RB Leipzig midfielder Assan Ouédraogo is a target for Chelsea and Manchester United. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Heisman Trophy race: Will Jeremiyah Love run past Fernando Mendoza, Julian Sayin?
content: The top candidates have emerged in the Heisman race, but what will it take for Jeremiyah Love to vault past Fernando Mendoza and Julian Sayin?

title: Pickups: Time to add Collin Gillespie, Derik Queen, Jusuf Nurkic
content: Every week in fantasy basketball, there are available players who can help fill holes in your roster. Here are the ones to add for the week ahead.

title: December schedule hacks: Stack your fantasy hockey lineups with Devils, Mammoth players
content: Your essential guide to lineup strategy for December, including how to use the NHL schedule to your advantage.

title: Weekly waiver pickups: Add these defensemen for assists, power-play points
content: The essential Monday guide to fantasy hockey pickups, with who to add and how to get set for the week ahead.

title: "Full Confidence In Security": Israel After Netanyahu's India Visit Deferred
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's office has clarified that they are working to 'coordinate a new visit date' to India amid reports of his visit being postponed due to security concerns.

title: Top Court Slams UP's Practice Of Giving Bureaucrats' Spouses Ex-Officio Posts
content: The Supreme Court came down on the Uttar Pradesh government for retaining the "colonial-era mindset" in governing cooperative societies and similar bodies where the spouses of bureaucrats like district magistrates are made ex-officio offic

title: 2 Groups Clash Over Sale Of Controversial Books In Madhya Pradesh
content: A row over the sale of controversial books took a violent turn on Tuesday, plunging Madhya Pradesh's Jabalpur into chaos.

title: On CCTV, Car Hits Sena Ex MLA From Behind, Narrowly Misses Her Grandchild
content: A former MLA of Eknath Shinde's Shiv Sena faction was hit from behind by a car while she was walking with her little grandchild and a woman in Maharashtra's Nashik.

title: Kali Statue Dressed As Mother Mary In Mumbai Temple, Priest Arrested
content: A statue of Goddess Kali in a Mumbai temple was dressed to resemble Mother Mary, shocking devotees and drawing the ire of Hindu organisations.

title: Bihar Uranium Study And The Dark Side Of Pay-To-Publish Research
content: The recent claim that uranium was detected in the breast milk of lactating mothers in Bihar sent shockwaves across media and public discourse.

title: "Don't Want To Turn Hyderabad Into Delhi": Telangana Minister Defends Land Conversion Policy
content: The political battle over Telangana's Hyderabad Industrial Lands Transformation Policy (HILTP) intensified today, with Deputy Chief Minister Mallu Bhatti Vikramarka launching a powerful counterattack against the Bharat Rashtra Samithi or BRS.

title: UP Man Spoke To Ex-Lover For Hours, Then Slit Her Throat With Sickle
content: A jilted lover was arrested on Tuesday for allegedly killing his "former partner" with a sickle for marrying someone else, police here said.

title: Burqa Stunt Gets Australian Senator Suspended From Parliament
content: An Australian senator who is campaigning for a national burqa ban was barred Tuesday from Parliament for the rest of the year for wearing the Muslim garment in the chamber.

title: 4 More Arrested Over $102 Million Louvre Jewel Heist
content: French authorities Tuesday arrested four more people in the probe into last month's spectacular daylight theft of imperial jewels from the Louvre museum, the top Paris prosecutor said.

title: Adani Enterprises Opens One Of India's Largest Rights Issues At Discount
content: Adani Enterprises Ltd, the flagship firm of billionaire Gautam Adani's conglomerate, on Tuesday launched subscriptions for one of India's largest rights issues, offering shares at Rs 1,800 apiece, a discount of roughly 24 per cent.

title: NEET Aspirant, 21, Dies After Falling From Moving Train In Rajasthan
content: A 21-year-old NEET aspirant allegedly died after falling from a moving train near the Keshoraipatan railway station in Rajasthan's Bundi district on Monday night, police said on Tuesday.

title: Karnataka Mother Of 4 Strangles Newborn. She Didn't Want Another Girl
content: A horrific incident in which a mother strangled her fourth newborn daughter to death has been reported from the Belagavi district of Karnataka on Tuesday, officials said.

title: "No One Came To Buy": Madhya Pradesh Banana Farmers Forced To Destroy Crop
content: The crisis for banana farmers in Dhar district, Madhya Pradesh, has reached a heartbreaking point they are now being forced to destroy their own harvest.

title: Smog Engulfs Mumbai As Air Quality Worsens, Civic Body Plans GRAP-4 Measures
content: Mumbai witnessed a thick blanket of smog on Tuesday as citywide air-quality readings surged into poor and severe categories, prompting the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) to step up emergency measures.

title: Pro-Police Protest In Delhi Amid Outrage Over Slogans Praising Madvi Hidma
content: Scores of people assembled at the India Gate in a show of support for the Delhi Police on Tuesday, two days after videos surfaced allegedly showing protesters raising slogans praising Maoist commander Madvi Hidma.

title: 26 Maoists With Rs 89 Lakh Collective Bounty Surrender In Chhattisgarh
content: Twenty-eight Maoists, 22 of them collectively carrying a reward of Rs 89 lakh on their heads, surrendered in Chhattisgarh's Narayanpur district.

title: Air Emergency: Delhi, Nearby Areas Gasped For Breath All Through November
content: India is battling for one of its most fundamental needs - clean air. In Delhi, residents have been protesting against toxic smog as the city's air quality has remained in the 'very poor' to 'severe' category for weeks.

title: Inspired By Trump Admin's DOGE, Japan To Launch Office To Cut Budget Waste
content: Japan launched its own version of the US government's infamous cost-cutting Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) on Tuesday in a bid to ease concerns over a $135-billion stimulus package.

title: Rajnath seeks global collaboration on India’s shipbuilding sector
content: Defence Minister says India is ready to help shape the “maritime century” by “building not only ships, but trust; not only platforms, but partnerships”

title: Mata Vaishno Devi University ‘gets government grants every year’: NC
content: When public money is involved, every citizen of this Union Territory has an equal right to be there, irrespective of religion or background, NC leader Tanvir Sadiq said, rebutting the BJP’s stand

title: Defending Mamkootathil embarrasses Congress, says Youth Cong. leader
content: She says the MLA shall be expelled from the primary membership of the party and workers need to be saved from the humiliating situation of needing to respond to the sexual misbehaviour allegations against him

title: Over 22,000 NHM doctors, health workers in Assam face job insecurity: Congress
content: The party said Ayushman Bharat card services remain suspended in the State’s private hospitals for a long time, causing immense hardship to the poor

title: Residents alarmed as pollution turns Doddagubbi lake toxic; fish and birds found dead
content: According to locals, the lake has been steadily degrading over the past several months, with the water turning a murky green due to suspected sewage inflow from nearby residential buildings.

title: Former Tripura CM slams State government for arresting CPI(M) workers on ‘flimsy grounds’
content: Manik Sarkar slammed the BJP and said that the use of “unethical means and pressure tactics” to muzzle the voices of people would “boomerang and isolate the oppressors”

title: Hyderabad heritage run to showcase city’s architectural legacy on February 1
content: The run is being positioned as a global platform to highlight Hyderabad’s heritage, says Tourism and Culture Minister Jupally Krishna Rao as he unveils the poster for the event

title: Army Chief pays homage to Operation Pawan bravehearts at National War Memorial
content: Hundreds of personnel were killed and over a thousand injured during Operation Pawan, the 1987 Indian Peace Keeping Force mission in Sri Lanka

title: Hyderabad zoo earns ISO tag for sixth time; Telangana launches tiger protection cell
content: New system will enable real-time monitoring of tiger reserves, says Minister; it will also enhance safety for people living near forest areas as alerts will be sent immediately if tiger movement is detected

title: BJD Rajya Sabha member Debasish Samantray quits party post
content: In a letter to former CM Naveen Patnaik, he says the party has failed to accept the cause of defeat in 2024 elections and take remedial measures

title: Rebels set to spoil party for all three fronts
content: Hundreds of political leaders appear to have taken their cue from M.K. Varghese, a Congress rebel-turned-Independent, who became Mayor of the Thrissur Corporation with the support of the Left Democratic Front, and have thrown their hats into the ring against the official candidates of their own parties

title: Caste must not be allowed to divide us, whatever the circumstance: CJI Kant
content: The CJI said elections to Maharashtra local bodies could go ahead, subject to the outcome of proceedings

title: General Education minister V. Sivankutty objects to use of schoolchildren for Special Intensive Revision (SIR) work
content: CEO says only students of ELCs in schools and colleges and NSS volunteers who have time and are volunteering will be included

title: CISF personnel honoured for saving lives, vital installations during Operation Sindoor
content: CISF personnel ensured the safety of about 250 civilians, and the Uri-I and Uri-II hydroelectric projects in May 2025

title: Benefits of growth should percolate to all sections of society: former RBI Governor
content: Global tariff-related uncertainties pose risks to growth prospects and financial stability, says Duvvuri Subbarao

title: A.P. to have Polavaram, Markapuram, Madanapalle as new districts, total to go up to 29
content: Five new revenue divisions, one new mandal, and several changes to existing boundaries also approved by CM following review of Ministers’ Committee recommendations; Penugonda mandal in West Godavari district to be named as Vasavi Penugonda

title: Andhra Pradesh Agriculture Minister urges farmers to stay alert as cyclone threat looms
content: With a deep depression set to intensify into a severe cyclone within 48 hours, Atchannaidu calls for heightened preparedness, directing officials to guide farmers, protect crops and livestock, and coordinate response efforts across vulnerable regions

title: Webinar on medtech to be held on November 28
content: The session aims to equip students, aspiring engineers, and young professionals with insights into emerging technologies, evolving career opportunities, and the increasing global demand within the sector

title: IAS officer Mahantesh Bilagi, two relatives die in road accident near Kalaburagi
content: They were all travelling from Ramdurg in Belagavi district to Kalaburagi to attend a family wedding when the accident occurred

title: Telangana Rising 2047 vision: State sets sight on emerging as investment magnet
content: The upgrade from a preferred location to be driven by emphasis on next phase of reforms around clearances, accelerated land sanction, setting up of a dry port and bolstering of local manufacturing

title: Madhampatty Pakashala case: Madras HC refuses to restrain Joy Crizildaa from using the brand’s hashtag on social media
content: Justice N. Senthilkumar dismissed the interim injunction application filed by Madhampatty Thangavelu Hospitality Private Limited

title: In Cheralayi, minority factor adds zest to four-cornered contest
content: BJP seeks vote for ‘continuity of development’ while LDF hopes to cash in on the addition of minority-centric areas to the division; former BJP leader Shyamala S. Prabhu, who is contesting as an Independent, says she wants to address basic issues, including housing, in the new areas; UDF flags civic problems

title: BJP says farmers suffer as Congress is preoccupied in a power tussle
content: Siddaramaiah has become visibly subdued after seeing Shivakumar approaching leaders in prison and those in hospital, says Ashok

title: Naidu orders strict oversight of SC, ST and BC hostels, warns of action for even minor lapses
content: Chief Minister issues firm directives to improve sanitation, drinking water and student safety across welfare hostels, approves ₹40 crore for pending toilet construction and mandates regular health checks, digital records and counselling support

title: Sabarimala sees eight cardiac deaths just eight days into the pilgrim season
content: ’During every pilgrimage which lasts over two months, on an average, some 150-odd cardiac events occur, resulting in about 40-42 deaths. This season, cardiac deaths has been moving at an unusual pace’

title: DPR for Ongole airport to be finalised soon, says MP
content: Magunta Sreenivasulu Reddy says the government has called for the consultants to prepare the techno-economic feasibility study report (TEFR) on the proposed greenfield airport

title: Indo-U.K. military exercise Ajeya Warrior-25 advances with high-intensity joint training in Rajasthan
content: Both contingents have executed a series of demanding activities, including firing practices, reflex shooting, rocket launcher firing, sniper and MMG drills, along with engagements replicating real combat situations, the Indian Army said

title: Caught for causing trouble, monkeys must be released 10 km away from human habitats: Mandates new GR
content: The Forest Department explains in the GR that repeated sightings of monkeys in urban markets, housing societies and farms had made the step necessary

title: Conservancy work to be outsourced soon in 2 more zones, Greater Chennai Corporation tells Madras High Court
content: GCC Commissioner J. Kumaragurubaran says the tender process in this regard is under way for Tondiarpet and Anna Nagar zones. He also denies the charge of unfair labour practices being followed against conservancy workers

title: Embezzlement at social media influencer's outlet: Crime Branch files chargesheet
content: Three employees and the husband of one of them embezzled ₹66 lakh from the jewellery outlet owned by BJP leader and actor Krishnakumar’s daughter Diya Krishna

title: Call for welfare schemes for entire transgender community, not just transwomen
content: The State government announced recently that women, including transwomen, will be given financial aid under its Sthree Suraksha Padhathi, but no specific schemes were announced for other transgender persons

title: Rowdy arrested for robbing 23 kg of silver bars from jeweller
content: The Halasuru Gate police have arrested a 45-year-old rowdy-sheeter who had robbed  23.2 kg of 49 silver bars worth ₹37 lakh from a jeweller

title: A.P. govt. unveils ₹40,000 crore plan to boost horticulture in Rayalaseema, Prakasam
content: Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu directs officials to prioritise cultivation of 18 globally sought after horticultural crops out of 65 crops grown in the region to increase farmer incomes

title: Women Commission chairperson calls for action against sale of liquor in rural areas, drug trafficking
content: She says that she has received numerous complaints from women about illegal sale of liquor in rural areas and its easy availability in many petty shops

title: BrahMos gold rush: India close to inking deals worth $450m; how Op Sindoor played role
content: India is close to signing defense deals worth $450 million for BrahMos supersonic cruise missiles. These advanced weapons impressed friendly nations after their precise strikes during a recent conflict. The missiles are also being integrated into the Indian Navy and Air Force. This development highlights India's growing defense capabilities and interest from global buyers.

title: 'Until Brahmin donates daughter': IAS officer's remark stirs row; issues clarification
content: A senior IAS officer in Madhya Pradesh faces backlash after a viral video showed him linking reservation continuation to inter-caste marriage. The All India Brahmin Society condemned the remarks as "indecent" and "casteist," demanding an FIR and disciplinary action. The officer later clarified his statement was taken out of context, expressing regret if sentiments were hurt.

title: Imran Khan, Bushra Bibi, Asim Munir: The silent coup and Pak's new triumvirate
content: In a dramatic shift, Pakistan's 27th Constitutional Amendment has completely altered its governance landscape. This change provides lifetime immunity to President Zardari and Field Marshal Munir, while jeopardizing the independence of the judiciary. With the military chief now controlling all major services, including the nuclear arsenal, the Supreme Court has been reduced to a mere puppet of the executive branch.

title: Left in lurch: With Red fading in Bengal and Tripura, will Kerala's communists find their direction?
content: India's Left faces an introspective period marked by declining vote shares and ideological confusion, evident in West Bengal and Tripura. While Kerala remains a stronghold, it too faces challenges, prompting questions about the party's ability to adapt and reinvent itself amidst shifting political landscapes and strategic alliances.

title: Normal 50 years after Tony Greig's 'Grovel', SA head coach repeats word
content: Conrad triggered controversy at the end of the fourth day’s play in Guwahati after using a phrase that carries a loaded history in cricket. Speaking at the press conference after  the day's play, Conrad said, "We wanted them (India) to really grovel." The Proteas kept on batting despite the lead crossing 500 in the second session and coach Shukri Conrad said they wanted to make sure they ended India's hopes of a series-levelling win.

title: AI chip throne shakes: Report hints Google-Meta deal; Nvidia's value crushed by $150bn
content: Nvidia's market value plunged over $150 billion following a report that Meta is exploring Google's AI chips. Meta, a major Nvidia customer, might rent Google's TPUs soon, potentially integrating them by 2027. This news boosted Alphabet's shares, signaling increased competition in the AI chip sector.

title: ICC T20 WC: Tournament to begin on February 7, final on March 8 - Check full schedule
content: The ICC has unveiled the schedule for the 2026 T20 World Cup, co-hosted by India and Sri Lanka. The tournament kicks off on February 7th, featuring Pakistan vs. Netherlands and India's title defense against the USA. The event will span 29 days across eight venues, culminating in the final on March 8th.

title: 'Don't recognise Arunachal': China on Indian harassed in Shanghai; Cong urges govt to reply
content: China denied harassing an Indian woman at Shanghai airport, stating border checks were lawful. The woman's passport was flagged due to Arunachal Pradesh being listed as her birthplace. India lodged a strong protest, asserting Arunachal Pradesh's status as an integral part of India.

title: Amazon's AI power play: Tech giant vetoes third-party tools; 'Kiro' takes centre stage
content: Amazon has directed its software engineers to cease using third-party AI coding tools like OpenAI's Codex and Anthropic's Claude Code, mandating exclusive use of its proprietary system, Kiro. This strategic move aims to bolster Amazon's competitive standing against rivals OpenAI and Google in the rapidly expanding AI code assistant market.

title: 'Delete Central govt': Mamata sets condition to back SIR; attacks EC, BJP over survey
content: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee expressed affection for Bangladesh due to shared language and criticized the BJP-led central government and Election Commission over the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of electoral rolls. She warned against rushing the process before the 2026 polls and accused the EC of losing impartiality, calling it a 'BJP Commission'.

title: T20 World Cup: Ind–Pak match set for February 15; check men in blue's full schedule
content: The ICC has unveiled the 2026 T20 World Cup schedule, co-hosted by India and Sri Lanka. Defending champions India begin their campaign against the USA in Mumbai on February 7. The highly anticipated India-Pakistan clash is slated for February 15 in Colombo. The tournament features 20 teams across eight venues, with knockout stage venues dependent on Pakistan's progression.

title: 'Secret deal': DKS refuses to speak on K'taka CM row; what Kharge said
content: Karnataka Deputy CM DK Shivakumar described the CM change issue as a "secret deal" among a few party leaders, stating he wouldn't discuss it publicly to avoid embarrassing the organization. He emphasized the importance of party unity and conscience. Meanwhile, Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge also stressed that leadership changes are not for public discussion.

title: Gemini 3.0 launch: Salesforce CEO says won't use ChatGPT again; praises Google’s AI model
content: Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff declared he's switching from ChatGPT to Google's Gemini 3.0 after a two-hour trial, citing significant improvements in reasoning, speed, image, and video processing. This endorsement highlights the intense competition in the AI landscape, with even OpenAI's CEO acknowledging Google's advancements.

title: 28 Naxalites quit arms: Group with Rs 89 lakh bounty surrenders in Chhattisgarh
content: Twenty-eight Naxalites, including 19 women and 22 cadres with rewards totaling Rs 89 lakh, surrendered in Chhattisgarh's Narayanpur district. Driven by development initiatives and rehabilitation policies, the surrender reflects a shift away from Maoist ideology. This follows over 512 cadres joining the mainstream in Bastar over the last 50 days.

title: 'Zubeen Garg murdered': Assam CM makes big claim; hints at shocking motive
content: Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma declared singer Zubeen Garg's death in Singapore a "plain and simple murder" in the state Assembly. He stated one person was responsible, with others aiding them. The opposition's adjournment motion to discuss the circumstances was admitted, with a Special Investigation Team and a judicial commission probing the incident.

title: Explained: ISI Bill 2025 and what it means for Kolkata’s control over its own institution
content: The draft Indian Statistical Institute Bill, 2025 proposes a major structural shift for ISI by replacing its society-based governance with a centrally defined statutory framework. For ISI Kolkata, this means a reorganisation of authority, decision-making and institutional hierarchy as the new Board of Governance becomes the primary decision-maker across academics, administration, finances and the future shape of ISI’s centres.

title: Heart health: How irregular sleep affect heart? What mechanisms trigger cardiac events?
content: Prioritizing quality sleep is crucial for a healthy heart, according to Dr. Irfan Khan.  Poor sleep, often due to modern lifestyle, disrupts vital bodily functions like blood pressure regulation and hormone balance.  This can significantly increase the risk of hypertension, heart disease, and other serious cardiovascular issues, even worsening existing conditions.

title: 'No good and bad Taliban': Pak refutes attacking Afghanistan; Kabul vows retaliation
content: Pakistan's military on Tuesday vehemently denied Afghan Taliban claims of conducting overnight airstrikes within Afghanistan, which reportedly killed ten people.  The Afghan government condemned the alleged "hostile actions" as a violation of sovereignty and vowed a response. Pakistan's army spokesperson dismissed the accusations as "baseless," highlighting a growing border dispute.

title: Will Trey Benson play Week 13? Cardinals eye return of explosive rookie
content: Injuries have plagued the Cardinals' backfield, with Trey Benson's season-ending injury after James Conner's sidelining disrupting their plans. Benson's return to practice offers a chance to re-evaluate the rushing attack and his potential as a foundational piece for the team's future.

title: Explained: Why Bitcoin is sliding — and why the pain may not be over
content: Bitcoin's recent steep fall, marked by a $1 trillion market wipeout, is attributed to five key factors identified by Deutsche Bank. These include a broader risk-off sentiment mirroring tech stocks, hawkish Fed signals, stalled regulatory clarity, institutional pullback after liquidations, and long-term holders cashing in, creating a liquidity shock.

title: 'China running racket': EU attacks Beijing; rare earth curbs cause rift
content: The EU has strongly criticized China's control over rare earth exports, with a top official labeling Beijing's restrictions a "racket" that jeopardizes Europe's strategic autonomy.  The bloc is urged to accelerate efforts to reduce its dependence on Chinese critical minerals by diversifying supply chains and strengthening domestic capacity.

title: South Africa eye clean sweep as India stare at a mountain they can not climb
content: India faces an uphill battle in the final Test, needing an improbable 522 runs after losing two early wickets. South Africa declared at 260/5, setting a daunting target. With a series sweep looming, the Proteas aim to take eight wickets on the final day, while India must survive an almost impossible chase.

title: 3 night time drinks that can help reduce High Blood Pressure in the morning
content: The minerals, calcium, potassium and magnesium present in milk help blood vessels relax, while maintaining proper fluid equilibrium. The cardiovascular system experiences reduced pressure because of these effects, which also enhance artery flexibility

title: Madeline Mann spills the beans on mastering the interview question most candidates get wrong
content: Madeline Mann, founder of Self Made Millennial, explains why the seemingly simple “Tell me about yourself” question often determines the course of an interview. She breaks down a precise three-step method—aligning your background with the job, highlighting measurable achievements, and ending with a clear “why”—to help candidates deliver sharper, more purposeful introductions and avoid common pitfalls.

title: Bruins’ Charlie McAvoy hit by heartbreaking week as wife Kiley shares update
content: Boston Bruins defenseman Charlie McAvoy is going through a devastating week. As his wife Kiley McAvoy revealed an emotional family update on social media. With Charlie already recovering from recent jaw surgery. The couple is now facing additional personal challenges involving their young son.

title: Don’t look at top stocks to buy! Should you invest in stocks directly at all?
content: Direct stock investing demands significant time, temperament, and skill, often exceeding what most salaried individuals can commit. Full-time fund managers possess these advantages. For most, a diversified mutual fund portfolio offers a more realistic path to wealth creation, avoiding common investor pitfalls like panic selling and excessive trading. Direct stocks can be explored as a small, experimental allocation.

title: Wig, makeup & horror: Man impersonates dead mother for pension
content: A shocking case has emerged in Italy where a former nurse allegedly mummified his mother's body to impersonate her for three years, claiming her pension and controlling her properties. The elaborate fraud unraveled during a routine identity card renewal at the registry office, leading to the discovery of the mummified remains and serious charges against the man.

title: 'Misfit for Army': SC flays Christian soldier's indiscipline; refused command to enter temple
content: The Supreme Court has upheld the dismissal of a Christian Army soldier for refusing to enter a gurdwara during a regimental activity, deeming his actions "gross indiscipline." Justices labelled him an "absolute misfit," emphasizing the paramount importance of discipline in the Army. The soldier's appeal was rejected, confirming his termination for placing personal beliefs above lawful commands.

title: B'luru horror: Man injects wife with mercury; dowry angle being probed
content: A Karnataka homemaker has accused her husband of injecting her with mercury nine months prior to her death, leading to a slow decline in her health.  Before passing away, she provided a pre-death statement to police detailing the alleged assault and subsequent suffering. The case is now being investigated as a potential dowry-related death.

title: A guide for women to freeze eggs properly, risks, outcomes and expectations
content: Egg freezing offers women extended reproductive choice, but it's not a guarantee of future pregnancy. Success hinges on age and the number of mature eggs retrieved, with younger women and those aiming for around fifteen eggs seeing better outcomes. Understanding the process's limitations and costs is crucial for informed decision-making.

title: 'Shouldn't coach be sacked': Raina defends Gambhir, reveals Team India's 'problem'
content: Suresh Raina defended head coach Gautam Gambhir amidst India's Test struggles, emphasizing player accountability. He highlighted Gambhir's success in white-ball formats and stressed that coaches guide, while players must perform. Raina also advocated for domestic performance to influence selection, anticipating a stronger ODI squad with Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli's return for the South Africa series.

title: Wayne Gretzky faces backlash as ‘Trump’s Canadian mascot’ label spreads
content: Canada's hockey icon Wayne Gretzky faced boos at a recent event, sparking debate about his association with American politics.  Gretzky, asserting his Canadian identity, stated he's "Canadian for life."  His response highlights the complex relationship between national heroes, personal choices, and public expectations, revealing much about Canadian pride and how deeply they connect with their sports symbols.

title: ‘Buying veggies felt like a full academic module’: Indian student on life abroad
content: Neeharika's study abroad journey from Bengaluru to the UK reveals a profound personal transformation. She navigated initial quietude and daily challenges, learning independence through everyday tasks. University life demanded self-direction, while building a community provided crucial support. This experience underscores that growth abroad is subtle, unfolding through ordinary moments and quiet victories, ultimately proving immensely rewarding.

title: 'King in his kingdom': Kohli arrives in India ahead of ODI series against SA - Watch
content: Virat Kohli has arrived in India for the upcoming ODI series against South Africa. The series begins on November 30. KL Rahul will captain the team. Ravindra Jadeja returns to the squad. Axar Patel has been excluded. The matches will be held in Ranchi, Raipur, and Visakhapatnam. Kohli last played in the ODI series against Australia in October. ​​

title: Silent for 10,000 years… then a blast: Eyewitnesses recall Ethiopia volcano eruption — watch
content: A remote Ethiopian volcano, dormant for millennia, erupted violently, spewing ash 15km high and darkening skies.  Locals described the blast as a "bomb of smoke and ash." While no lives were lost, the eruption has severely impacted livestock-herding communities, with ash covering grazing lands and threatening livelihoods.  The event has caused widespread shock due to its unprecedented nature.

title: 'Centuries-old pain put to rest': PM Modi at 'Dhwaj Arohan' ceremony; key takeaways
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi ceremonially hoisted a saffron Dharma Dhwaj atop the Ram temple in Ayodhya, marking its formal construction completion. He stated that the 'pain of centuries finds rest today' and the resolve of centuries is attaining fulfillment. The flag symbolizes the renaissance of Indian civilisation and the ideals of Ram Rajya.

title: Gold price today: Yellow metal jumps sharply; check 24K, 22K city-wise rates
content: Gold prices surged on Tuesday, driven by increasing expectations of a US Federal Reserve rate cut in December following dovish comments from officials. This optimism pushed bullion higher for the third consecutive session, with traders increasing bets on easier monetary policy. City-wise prices also saw an uptick across major Indian cities.

title: Kuwaiti authorities to revoke citizenship of prominent islamic Preacher
content: Kuwaiti authorities are set to revoke the citizenship of a prominent Islamic preacher, known for his media presence and cultural engagements, as part of efforts to safeguard the national identity system. The decision follows uniform legal standards applied to all similar cases. Formal procedures are underway, ensuring compliance with regulatory frameworks, while the preacher’s identity and family details remain undisclosed.

title: Megan Moroney addresses Nick Bosa dating rumors, says she’s focused on her career
content: Country star Megan Moroney is shutting down dating rumors, including those linking her to NFL player Nick Bosa, emphasizing her focus on a busy career. She clarifies past speculation about Morgan Wallen, stating they were never exclusively dating and remain friends. Moroney prioritizes authenticity and independence, building her success on honest songwriting and personal fulfillment, not romantic narratives.

title: 549-run target: Men in Blue hope for a miracle - what's highest total ever chased in India
content: South Africa declared their second innings at 260 for 5, setting India a daunting target of 549 runs. Tristan Stubbs' 94 and Tony de Zorzi's 49 anchored the innings after early wickets. This massive target represents the highest by a visiting team in India, posing a significant challenge for the hosts.

title: 'Will respond at right time': Taliban's warning after Pakistani air strikes kill 10
content: Overnight Pakistani air strikes in eastern Afghanistan killed 10 civilians, including nine children and one woman, prompting the Taliban to vow an "appropriate" response. The strikes in Khost, Kunar, and Paktika provinces injured four more civilians. This follows a deadly attack in Peshawar and previous cross-border clashes.

title: NEET PG counselling 2025 schedule revised: Registration for round 2 in Dec; check dates
content: The Medical Counselling Committee has released a revised schedule for NEET PG Round 2 counselling, commencing registration on December 5th. Key dates include choice filling until December 9th and results on December 12th.  Significant changes to the seat matrix involve adding 239 PG seats at deemed universities and removing 235 DNB seats. Reporting is scheduled from December 13th to 21st.

title: 'I don't need his money': Hema Malini on marrying Dharmendra
content: Dharmendra's personal life, particularly his marriage to Hema Malini while already married, is revisited. Malini recounts Dharmendra's initial charm and her eventual ultimatum, prioritizing his love over material possessions. She acknowledges their unconventional arrangement, living separately but emphasizing his consistent support for her and their daughters, stating she never wished to disrupt his existing family.

title: Operation Sindoor: 19 CISF personnel honoured; receive coveted 'DG's disk'
content: Bharti Jain is senior editor with The Times of India, New Delhi. She has been writing on security matters since 1996. Having covered the Union home ministry, security agencies, Election Commission and the ‘prime’ political beat, the Congress, for The Economic Times all these years, she moved to TOI in August 2012. Her repertoire of news stories delves into the whole gamut of issues related to terrorism and internal strife, besides probing strategic affairs in India’s neighbourhood. Read More

title: 📈 CFB Power Rankings: Two new teams join
content: americanC averaged 190.8 rushing yards across its first 10 games this fall . the no. 7 Ducks improved to 10-1 after a 42-27 win over the Trojans . it's a second straight college football playoff appearance in the 2025 season .

title: Who's making the grade, and who's failing at the NHL quarter mark? Grades for all 32 teams
content: the 2025-26 season has reached its quarter mark, with all 32 teams having played more than 20 games . a first-quarter letter grade for all 32 clubs is through the games of Nov. 23 . they lead the NHL in goals per game while also giving up the fewest goals .

title: Projecting the College Football Playoff top 12 after Week 13
content: the Sooners beat the Tigers 17-6 in Norman . there wasn't any movement in this week's top 12 projection . a dominant win against a now sub.-500 team isn't going to change the way the committee views Ohio State as the most complete team in the country .

title: Offseason grades: Judging the Nimmo-for-Semien swap for Mets, Rangers
content: the 2025-26 offseason is officially here, and we have you covered with grades and analysis for every major signing and trade this winter . if you're a big-money free agent signing that changes the course of your team's future, check back in for the freshest analysis through spring training .

title: Transfer portal primer: 'At 12:01 a.m. on Jan. 2, you're going to see people instantly commit'
content: the transfer portal officially opens on Jan. 2, the day after the college football playoff quarterfinals . the spring portal window in April means programs have one shot to get this right if they want to win big in 2026 . this season has brought more proof of concept that a portal-heavy approach can dramatically flip a program's fortunes, with Indiana and Texas Tech in the national championship hunt .

title: CFP Bubble Watch: Who's in, who's out, who has work to do in each league
content: six teams are still eligible to reach the ACC conference championship game . another four are still in contention to win the Big 12 . the college football playoff selection committee's fourth of six rankings will be announced tonight . it's unclear if the committee will react to Lane Kiffin's uncertain future .

title: 49ers top Panthers, as Christian McCaffrey beats former team
content: the 49ers beat the Carolina Panthers 20-9 in a game that figures to be pivotal in the NFC playoff chase . it happened again Monday night as the Niners overcame a litany of first-half mistakes to knock off a 49ers 20-9 . quarterback j'ayir brown provided the biggest slams for the Panthers .

title: Arman Tsarukyan reasserts his place near top at lightweight
content: arman Tsarukyan is one of the best lightweights in the world on saturday . he choked out Dan Hooker in a one-sided main event of UFC Fight Night in doha, Qatar . the only other movement in these rankings is at welterweight .
